byline.contributor: Janet Jarman contributed reporting from Mexico.

abstract: Aid groups and Mexican government have begun programs to link modern medicine and traditional midwifery in effort to reduce mortality among mothers in childbirth; death rates are particularly high in poor regions like Chiapas, where researchers estimate 55 of every 100,000 women in childbirth die.
lead_paragraph: The Mexican state, like many poor areas, has a high death rate among mothers in childbirth. In an effort to change that, village midwives are being linked to modern medicine.

headline.main: Training Midwives to Save Expectant Mothers in Chiapas

snippet: The Mexican state, like many poor areas, has a high death rate among mothers in childbirth. In an effort to change that, village midwives are being linked to modern medicine.
